segments.text: Judy , your husband has a really nice car .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thanks . It's a lot better than mine , and it's new .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We're going to visit my sister in the city .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I didn't know your sister lives in the city , when did she move there ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: About a year ago . She lives in an apartment on 3rd street , across from the public library .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . It's almost 5:00 PM now , don't you think there will be a lot of traffic ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , we're not driving . We're going to take the subway . The subway only takes about 20 minutes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , but it can be very crowded around this time . I always feel uncomfortable taking the subway .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I take the subway to work everyday , so I'm used to it now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Doesn't your mother live in the city ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , she's lived there for about ten years .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I remember when she moved there . Apartments were a lot cheaper then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know what you mean . It's hard to find anything that's reasonable now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Have a good time . Next time you're free , give me a call and we'll go play poker .
segments.speaker: S1
